Author: trev5514
Content: Has anyone used Slang and gotten the power ports to work? It looks like yosys-slang doesn't support inout ports?

Author: mole99
Content: It does support them, but I think you need to keep the hierarchy, if I recall correctly. See here: https://github.com/mole99/greyhound-ihp/blob/2a2cf3e284a2f2486b71e48212d01458f55e8a0e/config.yaml#L103

Author: trev5514
Content: Looks like that worked, thanks!

Author: mole99
Content:
Alright, I absolutely get your point. The problem with waiving is, there is currently no way to ignore a cell in KLayout with the current setup afaik.
In the worst case I can take a manual look at the submission and waive those errors.
Ideally, I would find the time to fix them before the tapeout, unfortunately time is currently rare.

Author: mole99
Content: Could you open an issue detailing both issues (collecting the info from above)?

Author: _luke_w_
Content: ok, in that case is there a way to add a `grep -v` or so to the log lint in librelane?

Author: _luke_w_
Content: Separately I get magic DRC errors for overlapping identical filler cells (I think other people have seen this) and this is harmless afaict but prevents me from running `make copy-final`

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: What causes  icgtp?

Author: _luke_w_
Content: either clock gating inference or manual instantiation (I have both)

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: hmm

Author: mole99
Content: LibreLane counts the DRC errors in the `.lydrb` that was produced by KLayout. So I don't think that would help. You would need a filter inside of that function.

Author: _luke_w_
Content: how have people waived DRCs on past tapeouts?

Author: _luke_w_
Content: (I'm filing an issue with all of the pictures)

Author: mole99
Content:
I don't think that's the issue. The default template should also have these overlap issues, but they should be ignored by LibreLane afaik.
If you get any DRC violations, LibreLane won't create the `final` folder.
